Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: zeolite-like eight-membered ring pores and interlayer spaces

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: exchange with acetonitrile in intralayer microchannels

Other Information.Additional Info: Benzoic acid adsorption initiated by pre-adsorbed acetonitrile expanding the intralayer microchannels.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: adsorption in interlayer space in water, intralayer microchannels in acetonitrile

Other Information.Additional Info: Phenol adsorption depends on the solvent: hydrophobic interaction in acetonitrile, hydrophilic interaction in water.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: accommodation in intralayer microchannels via hydrophobic interactions

Other Information.Test Conditions: vapor phase and liquid phase, room temperature
Other Information.Additional Info: Acetonitrile pre-adsorption expands intralayer microchannels, enabling further adsorption of benzoic acid or phenol.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale via flexible intralayer microchannels

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Maximum benzoic acid uptake: ~2 mmol/g; Basal spacing expansion to 1.36 nm during adsorption

Other Information.Additional Info: H-SiO2 exhibits gate-opening behavior due to flexible framework allowing expansion for molecular uptake.
H-mag does not adsorb benzoic acid effectively; basal spacing increases gradually.
Phenol adsorption occurs preferentially in the interlayer spaces of H-mag.

Other Information.Test Conditions: vapor phase and liquid phase, room temperature
Other Information.Additional Info: Acetonitrile adsorption causes gradual basal spacing increase but no abrupt uptake like in H-SiO2.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Basal spacing increases gradually during adsorption; lower adsorption capacity than H-SiO2
